clinical_study.brief_title: Safety & Efficacy of Omega-3 Fish Oil in Overweight Children & Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Efficacy of Omega-3 Fish Oil Dietary Supplementation in Biometric Measurement, Lipid Profile, Serum Markers for Inflammation, and Insulin Resistance in Overweight Children and Adolescents

brief_summary.textblock: Children with an excess in body weight, increase the risk of obesity-related co-morbidities and cardiovascular diseases. Childhood obesity may be due to diets laden with fat and lack of physical activity. Omega-3 fish oil is a supplementation that may promote a greater reduction of pro-inflammatory mediators; combined with exercise and nutritional regimens it may also help improve glycemic, lipid markers, and body composition in overweight children and adolescents.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Zone Labs, Inc discontinue utilizing their fish oil supplement and frozen foods

primary_outcome.measure: To compare effects between Omega 3 fish oil and placebo
primary_outcome.description: To compare the effect of Omega 3 fish oil dietary supplementation versus placebo on biometric measurement, lipid profile, serum markers for inflammation and insulin resistance in overweight children and adolescents undergoing treatment with a low-glycemic load diet and exercise.

secondary_outcome.measure: To compare effects between Omega 3 fish oil and placebo
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the changes in weekly physical activity, biometrics measurements and body mass index between overweight children and adolescents receiving Omega 3 fish oil supplementation versus placeb
